_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Keys with _else are produced with non-trained Stanford NLP and as such only includes capitalized words. The + designates a segment range. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.
before^dn32:2.2^who_around: Four Great Kings, spirits, fairies, goblins, and dragons
dn32:3.2+dn32:7.90^where_else_mentioned: Sun, Uttarakuru, Mount Meru, Kusināṭā, Parakusināṭā, Kapīvanta, Jonogha, Navanavutiya, Kuvera, Tatolā, Tattalā, Tatotalā, Ojasi, Tejasi, Tatojasi, Sūra, Rājā, Ariṭṭha, Nemi
dn32:3.2+dn32:7.90^who_else_mentioned: Hail Vipassī, Hail Sikhī, Hail Vessabhū, Hail Kakusandha, Māra, Hail Koṇāgamana, Hail Kassapa, Hail Aṅgīrasa, Sakyan, Gotama, Aditi, Dhataraṭṭha, Indra, Buddha, Kinsman, Virūḷha, Virūpakkha, Nāṭasuriyā, Parakusiṭanāṭā, Vessavaṇa, Bhagalavatī
before^dn32:13.1^who_mentioned: Indra, Soma, Varuṇa, Bhāradvāja, Pajāpati, Candana, Kāmaseṭṭha, Kinnughaṇḍu, Nighaṇḍu, Panāda, Opamañña, Mātali, Vipassī, the king of Magadha, bandits, Cittasena, Nala, Janesabha, Sātāgira, Hemavata, Puṇṇaka, Karatiya, Guḷa, Sivaka, Mucalinda, Vessāmitta, Yugandhara, Gopāla, Supparodha, Hiri, Netti, Mandiya, Pañcālacaṇḍa, Āḷavaka, Pajjunna, Sumana, Sumukha, Dadhimukha, Maṇi, Māṇivara, Dīgha, Serīsaka
